lines.text: Pharaoh commands more bricks! And now, gather your own straw. The quota remains the same!
How can we make the same number of bricks when we must now gather straw ourselves? This burden is too great!
I see your suffering. The cruelty of the Egyptians grows worse each day.
The people's strength fails them. Their spirits break under this hardship.
My hands are raw from making bricks without proper straw. How much longer must we endure this?
The Lord has seen your affliction. He has heard your groaning. The time of deliverance draws near.
Father, will we ever leave this place? Will we ever be free?
With each brick we make, our backs bend further under Pharaoh's yoke.
Take heart. The God of our fathers has not forgotten His promise.
The Lord said to me, 'Take this staff in your hand so you can perform the signs with it.'
With this staff, you have performed wonders before Pharaoh, yet his heart remains hardened.
Is this staff truly powerful enough to free us from bondage?
The power is not in the staff, but in the Lord who guides my hand.
I'm beginning to believe that perhaps the God of our fathers has not forgotten us.
Faith is the seed from which deliverance will grow. Trust in the Lord and His promises.
The people's faith grows stronger. They begin to remember the promises made to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.
Four hundred years we have waited. Is this truly the time of deliverance our fathers were promised?
I can feel the Lord's presence growing stronger among us. His promises will soon be fulfilled.
Mother says we will journey to a land flowing with milk and honey. Is it true?
Yes, child. The Lord swore to bring us out of misery in Egypt into a good and spacious land.
The faith of our people is strong! Now the Lord will show His power to Pharaoh.
This is the same God who appeared to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. He will fulfill His covenant.
Let the Lord, God of our fathers, deliver us with His mighty hand!
Work faster! The day grows short and Pharaoh demands his bricks before sundown!
We must hurry. The overseers will punish us if we fail to meet our quota.
The sun is setting! We must finish our work quickly before the taskmasters return.
Father, I'm so tired... but I'll help gather more straw.
We're halfway to meeting our quota, but my strength is failing.
Take courage, brother. Remember that the Lord has promised deliverance.
I will speak to Pharaoh again. The Lord our God commands him to let our people go.
I will go with you, brother. The Lord has chosen me to be your voice.
May the God of our fathers be with you as you stand before Pharaoh.
The Lord has heard your groaning. The time of deliverance draws near.
You have failed to meet your quota! Tomorrow your work will be doubled!
We cannot bear this burden any longer. Where is this deliverance you promised, Moses?
O Lord, why have You brought trouble on this people? Why did You send me?
Have faith, brother. The Lord's plan will unfold in its time.
